Text: Give thanks to the LORD; call upon His name; make known His deeds among the nations.
Context: The psalmist is inviting the audience to express gratitude and spread the word of God’s works.

Text: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; tell of all His wondrous works.
Context: The verse emphasizes worship through singing and recounting the wonders God has done.

Text: Glory in His holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
Context: Encouragement to take pride in seeking God and to be joyful in this pursuit.

Text: Seek out the LORD and His strength; seek His face always.
Context: The psalmist urges the audience to continually look for God and rely on His strength.

Text: Remember the wonders He has done, His miracles, and the judgments He pronounced,
Context: The focus is on recalling the miraculous and just nature of God‘s actions.

Text: O offspring of Abraham His servant, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.
Context: The verse identifies the audience as the descendants of Abraham and Jacob, chosen by God.

Text: He is the LORD our God; His judgments govern the whole earth.
Context: Acknowledgement of God’s sovereignty and the universality of His justice.

Text: He remembers His covenant forever, the word He commanded for a thousand generations,
Context: This verse highlights God‘s faithfulness and lasting commitment to His covenant.

Text: the covenant He made with Abraham, and the oath He swore to Isaac.
Context: Refers to the specific covenant with the patriarchs of the Jewish faith.

Text: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
Context: Indicates the continuation and everlasting nature of the covenant to the people of Israel.

Text: Saying, ”To you I will give the land of Canaan as the portion of your inheritance.“
Context: Promise from God to give the descendants of Abraham the land of Canaan.

Text: When they were few in number, few indeed, and strangers in it,
Context: Describes the early state of the Israelites, when they were just beginning and nomadic.

Text: They wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
Context: Describes the nomadic movements of the ancestors of Israel, indicating a time of uncertainty.

Text: He allowed no one to oppress them; He rebuked kings on their behalf:
Context: Highlights God’s protection over the Israelites from potential oppressors.

Text: ”Do not touch My anointed ones; do no harm to My prophets.“
Context: God‘s warning to others regarding His chosen people, declaring them untouchable.

Text: He called down famine on the land and cut off all their supply of bread.
Context: A reference to a period of hardship and famine that was part of God’s plan.

Text: He sent a man before them—Joseph, sold as a slave.
Context: Introduces the story of Joseph, setting the stage for the narrative of his rise in Egypt.

Text: They bruised his feet with shackles; his neck was put in irons,
Context: Describes the suffering Joseph endured while being a prisoner in Egypt.

Text: Until the time came to fulfill his dreams, the LORD tested Joseph‘s character.
Context: Explains that Joseph’s trials were part of God‘s plan and tested his virtue.

Text: The king sent and released him; the ruler of peoples set him free.
Context: Tells of Joseph’s rise to power when the Pharaoh of Egypt releases him from prison.

Text: He made him master of his house and ruler over all his possessions,
Context: Shows the extent of Joseph‘s authority bestowed by Pharaoh as a result of his wisdom.

Text: to instruct his princes as he pleased and teach his elders wisdom.
Context: Indicates Joseph’s role in guiding and educating the Egyptian leaders in wisdom.
